content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory Interface at Position (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the following entities:
• Cable factory input chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
• Burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) placed using direction RIGHT, which is networked with:
 – A burner inserter at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5)
 – An assembling machine at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5)

### Depot Belt System at Position (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of the following entities:
• Wooden chest (serving as the belt depot) at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
• Transport belt segment at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5) positioned adjacent to the depot chest
• Depot burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) placed with direction UP, linking the depot chest to the belt network

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Transport Belt Connection Error  
 – When connecting transport belts (as seen in Steps 210, 211, 214, 215, 216, and 217), ensure that the final target is not a Prototype.SteamEngine but a valid inserter that can input items into the engine.

• Placement Distance Error  
 – If an entity (such as a wooden chest) fails to be placed due to excessive distance from the player (e.g. target at (3.5,15.5) while the player is at (0,0)), move closer to the target position before placement.

• Variable Reference Error  
 – Resolve NameError issues (e.g. “target_chest” not defined) by using consistent and correct variable names when referencing target positions or entities.

• Inventory Shortage Error  
 – Before attempting placement, verify that the required entity (wooden chest) is present in the inventory to avoid placement failures.
